messages.content: Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of an airline, with tables for flights, reservations, passengers, luggage and pilot.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Bank, with tables for Handling of accounts, transactions, and customer data.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model customer {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  phone     String?
  accounts  account[]
}

model account {
  id                  Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  customer_id          Int
  customer            customer      @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])
  type                String       
  balance             Float
  created_at           DateTime      @default(now())
  transactions_origin  transaction[] @relation("Origin")
  transactions_destiny transaction[] @relation("Destiny")
  branch_id            Int           
  branch              branch        @relation(fields: [branch_id], references: [id])
  loanId              Int
  loan                loan          @relation(fields: [loanId], references: [id])
}

model transaction {
  id              Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  account_origin_id Int
  account_destiny_id Int
  account_origin    account @relation(name: "Origin", fields: [account_origin_id], references: [id])
  account_destiny   account @relation(name: "Destiny", fields: [account_destiny_id], references: [id])
  amount           Float
  date             DateTime @default(now())
}

model employee {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  position String
  email    String @unique
  branch   branch @relation(fields: [branch_id], references: [id])
  branch_id Int
}

model branch {
  id       Int        @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  location String
  employees employee[]
  accounts  account[]
}

model loan {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  amount      Float
  interest_rate Float
  start_date   DateTime
  due_date     DateTime
  account     account[]
}
"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Conferences with tables for Participants, schedule, and ticket sales.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model participant {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[] @relation("sessionparticipants")
}

model session {
  id              Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  title           String
  star_time       DateTime
  end_time         DateTime
  speaker_id       Int
  speaker         speaker       @relation(fields: [speaker_id], references: [id])
  participants    participant[] @relation("sessionparticipants")
  event_id         Int           
  event           event         @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id]) 
}

model speaker {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  bio       String
  sessions  session[]
}

model ticket {
  id            Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  type          String
  price         Float
  participant_id Int
  participant   participant @relation(fields: [participant_id], references: [id])
  event_id       Int
  event         event       @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
  @@index([participant_id, event_id])
}

model event {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  location  String
  date      DateTime
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[]
  logistics logistics[]
  @@index([name, location, date])
}

model logistics {
  id          Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  description String
  event_id     Int
  event       event   @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
}
"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of events with tables for participants, agenda, tickets, and for logistic employees

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model participant {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[] @relation("session_participants")
}

model session {
  id              Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  title           String
  start_time      DateTime
  end_time        DateTime
  speaker_id      Int
  speaker         speaker       @relation(fields: [speaker_id], references: [id])
  participants    participant[] @relation("session_participants")
  event_id        Int           
  event           event         @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id]) 
}

model speaker {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  bio       String
  sessions  session[]
}

model ticket {
  id            Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  type          String
  price         Float
  participant_id Int
  participant   participant @relation(fields: [participant_id], references: [id])
  event_id       Int
  event         event       @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
  @@index([participant_id, event_id])
}

model event {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  location  String
  date      DateTime
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[]
  logistics logistics[]
  @@index([name, location, date])
}

model logistics {
  id          Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  description String
  event_id     Int
  event       event   @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
  logistics_employees logistics_employee[]
}

model logistics_employee {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String
  role        String
  logistics_id Int
  logistics   logistics @relation(fields: [logistics_id], references: [id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of galery art, with tables for  Artwork, artists and Exhibition
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Government with tables for civil records, identification documents, and electoral management

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model civil_record {
  id                  Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id           Int                @unique
  birth_certificate   String             @unique
  marriage_certificate String?           
  death_certificate   String?            
  person              person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model identity_document {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id         Int                @unique
  passport_number   String             @unique
  national_id       String             @unique
  driver_license    String?            
  person            person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model electoral_management {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id         Int                @unique
  voter_id          String             @unique
  election_name     String
  has_voted         Boolean            @default(false)
  person            person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model person {
  id                    Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  identification_number String             @unique
  first_name            String
  last_name             String
  date_of_birth         DateTime
  civil_record          civil_record?
  identity_document     identity_document?
  electoral_management  electoral_management?
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Gym with tables for memberships, classes, trainers, personal, members and schedules
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of an hospital with tables for patients, doctors, medical records, and appointments
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Hotel with tables for reservations, rooms, services, and hotel managers

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model hotel {
  id            Int            @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String         @unique
  address       String
  rooms         room[]
  services      service[]
  reservations  reservation[]
  hotel_manager hotel_manager?
}

model room {
  id        Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  number    String      @unique
  capacity  Int
  hotel_id  Int
  hotel     hotel       @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
  bookings  reservation[]
}

model service {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  price    Float
  hotel_id Int
  hotel    hotel  @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
}

model reservation {
  id         Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  start_date DateTime
  end_date   DateTime
  guest_name String
  room_id    Int
  room       room      @relation(fields: [room_id], references: [id])
  hotel_id   Int
  hotel      hotel     @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
  @@index([guest_name, hotel_id,room_id])
}

model hotel_manager {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  ubication String
  country String
  hotel_id Int    @unique
  hotel    hotel  @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Insurance with tables for insurance policies, insured data, claims, and users
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Libraries with tables for Book catalog, loans, and users
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of park with tables for amusement_park, entry, attraction, client, maintenance_log

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model amusement_park {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String             @unique
  location          String
  entries           entry[]
  attractions       attraction[]
  clients           client[]
}

model entry {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  date              DateTime
  client_id         Int
  client            client             @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
  ticket_type       String
  amusement_park_id Int                // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park     @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model attraction {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String             @unique
  type              String
  status            String
  maintenance_logs  maintenance_log[]
  amusement_park_id Int                // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park     @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model client {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String
  email             String             @unique
  phone_number      String             @unique
  entries           entry[]
  maintenance_logs  maintenance_log[]
  amusement_park_id Int?               // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park?    @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model maintenance_log {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  date              DateTime
  description       String
  attraction_id     Int
  attraction        attraction         @relation(fields: [attraction_id], references: [id])
  client_id         Int
  client            client             @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Schools with tables for Student information, grades, Subjects, Courses and class schedules
